meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! Here's my review of The Settlers: New Allies, a game that's got everyone from SpazioGames to Wccftech scratching their heads.

Now, I know what you're thinking - why should I care about a game that's been panned by critics left and right? Well, let me tell you, folks. As someone who loves a good city-builder/RTS hybrid, I'm here to give you the lowdown on whether New Allies is worth your time.

First off, let's talk about the gameplay. Now, I'm no fan of SpazioGames' review (55 out of 100? Please!), but even they acknowledged that the crossover between classic Settlers gameplay and RTS elements feels "dull and rushed." And don't even get me started on GamingTrend - "poor execution" indeed! The game just can't seem to get its act together.

But here's the thing: I actually kind of enjoyed New Allies. It's not perfect, no way, but there's a certain charm to it that keeps you coming back for more. Maybe it's the wholesome visuals (PC Gamer gave 'em props for that), or maybe it's just my inner city-builder nerd speaking.

Now, don't get me wrong - GameCritics, IGN Italia, and Wccftech all had their own grievances with the game. And honestly, I can see why. The narrative is a bit flat (GameCritics hit 'em hard for that), and the game does feel a bit shallow at times.

But you know what? I think New Allies might be exactly what some folks need - a relaxing, low-key RTS experience that doesn't require me to sacrifice my sanity trying to keep up with the latest multiplayer drama. And hey, if it's not your cup of tea, well, there's always GameStar's review for... um... "entertainment" purposes? Yeah, I won't say what they said.

In the end, The Settlers: New Allies isn't going to win any awards - at least, not according to most critics. But if you're looking for a game that's just plain fun, without all the bells and whistles (and, honestly, who needs those anyway?), then this might be the one for you.

So what do I say? Hippo Penny out!
